Package domain

Class RosterManager

java.lang.Object
domain.RosterManager
public class RosterManager extends Object
User interface class that handles line commands entered on the console and displays the results on the console.
Author:
Joshua McArdle

    Helper method for run() command, uses .split() method to grab the operation code and data tokens necessary to manage the student roster.

    Helper method for addCommand(), checks if the number of credits is valid.
    private boolean
    dateError()
    Helper method for addCommand(), calls the isValid() method from Date class and prints whether a student is younger than 16 years old or if the DOB is invalid.

    Helper method for operations(), prints out the roster of students in a specified school, sorted by last name, first name, and DOB.

    Helper method for addCommand() and changeMajorCommand(), checks if the given major exists.

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • RosterManager

      public RosterManager()
      Empty constructor, used by the driver class RunProject1.

  • Method Details

    • operations

      private void operations()
      Takes in the operation code from a line command and uses a switch case to perform various operations. Calls different helper methods based on the operation code.

    • addCommand

      private boolean addCommand()
      Helper method for operations(), adds a student to the roster.
      Returns:
      false if date of birth is invalid, major doesn't exist, credits are invalid, or if student exists in the roster already and true otherwise.

    • removeCommand

      private boolean removeCommand()
      Helper method for operations(), removes a student from the roster.
      Returns:
      false if student is not in the roster and true otherwise.

    • printCommand

      private boolean printCommand()
      Helper method for operations(), prints out the roster of students sorted by last name, first name and DOB.
      Returns:
      false if roster is empty and true otherwise.

    • printByStandingCommand

      private boolean printByStandingCommand()
      Helper method for operations(), prints out the roster of students sorted by standing.
      Returns:
      false if roster is empty and true otherwise.

    • printBySchoolMajorCommand

      private boolean printBySchoolMajorCommand()
      Helper method for operations(), prints out the roster of students sorted by school and major.
      Returns:
      false if roster is empty and true otherwise.

    • listCommand

      private void listCommand()
      Helper method for operations(), prints out the roster of students in a specified school, sorted by last name, first name, and DOB.

    • changeMajorCommand

      private boolean changeMajorCommand()
      Helper method for operations(), changes a student's major.
      Returns:
      false if roster is empty, student is not in the roster, or major doesn't exist and true otherwise.

    • dateError

      private boolean dateError()
      Helper method for addCommand(), calls the isValid() method from Date class and prints whether a student is younger than 16 years old or if the DOB is invalid.
      Returns:
      false if student is younger than 16 years old or if DOB is invalid and true otherwise.

    • majorError

      private boolean majorError()
      Helper method for addCommand() and changeMajorCommand(), checks if the given major exists.
      Returns:
      false if major is invalid and true otherwise.

    • creditsError

      private boolean creditsError()
      Helper method for addCommand(), checks if the number of credits is valid.
      Returns:
      false if credits is a negative number or not an integer and true otherwise.

    • convertToTokens

      private void convertToTokens(String elements)
      Helper method for run() command, uses .split() method to grab the operation code and data tokens necessary to manage the student roster.
      Parameters:
      elements - the String input from line commands that is to be converted.

    • run

      public void run()
      Method for parsing input from the command line and continuously reads line commands until the user quits.
